formattedAddress: 50 W 72nd St, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 50 W 72nd St, New York, NY 10023, USA

editorialSummary.text: Sophisticated yet casual, comfy locale offering wines by the glass & tapas-style Italian bites.

originalText.text:
My friend and I came here for a quick drink before catching a show in the Beacon Theatre. Lilly’s Cocktail and Wine is a cozy bar that really decked out for the Halloween and fall vibes.

We were able to be seated right away, and was able to pretty much order, finish our drinks, and leave within 40 minutes.

I got the Uptown Girl, which was a floral and strong drink. I thought it would be a bit sweeter, but it ended up being tarter than I thought.

My friend got the Dark Fables, which she really liked. Sadly, it had walnut bitters, which I’m allergic to, but it looked good!

The atmosphere was pretty intimate but lively! It looks like a good place to catch up with a group of friends or meet up for a date.

originalText.text: Our waitress was super nice. There was a wide selection of food for vegetarians and non vegetarians. Nice outdoor seating or indoor. Slightly noisier inside. Fun selection of drinks and food. Food was good quality and yummy. Nice option on Saturday afternoon. We were pleased. Inside is a tad small so not ideal for groups.

Fun selection of drinks and food. Food was good quality and yummy. Nice option on Saturday afternoon. We were pleased. Inside is a tad small so not ideal for groups.

originalText.text: Bad service, food not that good. Flatbread with pumpkin is terrible, Pear Cobbler was nice. Only went there because 30+ min line in other brunch places in UWS

text.text: Bad service, food not that good. Flatbread with pumpkin is terrible, Pear Cobbler was nice. Only went there because 30+ min line in other brunch places in UWS

originalText.text:
Atrocious service.

This place had been our list to visit for some time, mostly due to the drink menu. Showed up at 10pm for drinks. The waiter got very upset when our party did not know what they wanted to drink immediately after being seating. So, he decided to give us a good half hour to think about our drink choices. Generous. We should have read the warning signs and left then. After making a our drink order, the waiter became even more upset that we did not put in a food order. Frankly, I did not think this was a breach of protocol. Nobody else in our area had ordered food either. Forty-five minutes after putting our order in, we started to get impatient. Why did we stay so long? A combination of good conversation and the sink cost fallacy. I asked the waiter when our drink was coming. He told us that since we didn’t order food, our drinks would have to wait. He was absolutely hostile. Wouldn’t even give us more water. Talked to the hostess, and that seemed to purr something. Got our drinks soon after. Drinks were great- really. I had an Enchanted Spell that was a perfect compilation of smoky and sweet.

Pity the service wasn’t even 1/10 as good.

I will not be back.

originalText.text:
Cute place with indoor and outdoor seating. We were informed in advance that food will take some time to arrive. We had LILLY'S PILSNER, Western omelet, Lillys breakfast burger and WAFFLE A LA MODE.
Very happy with the burger and Waffle but Omelet and toast were burnt.
